name: Allianz + Anthropic
title: AI Logging for Compliance

classification.classificationRationale: Reclassified from Model 2 to Model 6a. Decision tree: no evidence of a formal AI lab or CoE at Allianz — Claude Code was deployed to all employees as an enterprise-wide tool. The compliance logging feature suggests strong governance but not a separate CoE structure. Contextual orientation: employees use AI within their existing roles. Low confidence because the specimen conflates Anthropic's business data with Allianz's organizational structure, and we have minimal data on Allianz's actual internal AI governance.

description:
Allianz, one of the world's largest insurance and financial services companies, partnered with Anthropic to deploy Claude Code to all employees and build custom AI agents for multistep workflows. The deployment emphasizes compliance by design: the AI system logs all interactions for regulatory transparency, creating audit trails reviewable for regulatory purposes, internal compliance, or dispute resolution. This approach attempts to satisfy both efficiency goals and the heavy regulatory requirements of the insurance industry.

The deployment uses a human-in-the-loop model for AI agents executing complex workflows, balancing automation with oversight. The enterprise-wide rollout without a formally branded AI lab suggests an adoption-first approach rather than a structured innovation program.
